CatDescriptText: Mrs. Blanche Coward, hotel employee, Donora and Mr. Fred Cole, maintenance man, Homestead, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 12, 1962, pg. 13  with question: "Do you think the Kennedy Administration is anti-big business?"  Mrs. Coward's answer reads: "Truthfully, I don't think that the Administration is against big business.  I think that he's doing what is right for the people."  Mr. Cole's answer reads: "No, I don't think he's against big business.  In fact I think that he's for big business."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Blanche Coward wearing earrings and plaid vest, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Fred Cole wearing sunglasses, patterned shirt, and wool sweater, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
